sub_topic: Finding the chromatic index of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the graph G shown below:

```
 A ----- B
 |       |
 |       |
 C ----- D
```

What is the minimum number of colors required to color the edges of G so that no two adjacent edges have the same color?
message_2:
To color the edges of graph G with the minimum number of colors so that no two adjacent edges have the same color, we can use the following coloring:

```
 A --1-- B
 |       |
2|       |2
 |       |
 C --1-- D
```

Here, we have used 2 colors (1 and 2) to color the edges of the graph. No two adjacent edges have the same color. Therefore, the minimum number of colors required is 2.
